intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium triste var. tristiforme, commonly known as the gloomy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers and hairy, basal leaves. This variant is known for its distinctive, elongated leaf shape and is often found in disturbed soils across Europe. It is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, open habitats. The plant's botanical features make it identifiable within the Hieracium genus, though it is less common than other species in the group.
